introduction: My first job was with a major consulting company in Japan. I appreciated my time there, but was always yearning to do something with a greater direct impact, and something that gives me a greater sense of purpose. I am blessed to have the opportunity to travel the world, and be exposed to different perspectives, ways of living and available alternatives!

career_journey.motivation: Yearning to do something with greater direct impact and sense of purpose
career_journey.exposure: Travel the world, exposed to different perspectives, ways of living and available alternatives

merchandise_blue: A series of serendipitous events led to the founding of merchandise.blue with two highly experienced and interesting friends. Merchandise.blue offered merchandise like uniforms, towels and bags in more environmentally progressive textiles made of materials like seaweed, organic cotton and recycled fishing nets.

previous_venture.co_founders: Two highly experienced and interesting friends

kizuna_motivation: When the opportunity to open Kizuna arose, it was clear that I wanted to apply similar values and principles to this physical space.
top_3_advice: Just start, even if you cannot achieve 100% sustainability. It is ok. It is more important to start and reduce the environmental impact, even if it is not a gigantic leap.
Being financially sustainable in your business is also important for you to continue on your quest to be more environmentally sustainable.
Find a community and talk to others. You may discover new ideas and solutions to your problem.
how_help_users: I can share my experiences about setting up a space, and I am open to collaborations that promote sustainability.

kizuna_concept.approach: Entirely revamped space using recovered materials
kizuna_concept.mission: Prove that we can try to do things better even when running a for-profit business
kizuna_concept.goal: Spark thoughts and conversations about circular economy, environment and sustainability

sustainability_philosophy: Because of the people whom I've met and the experiences that I've had in the last couple of years, sustainability was one of the key considerations in my design brief for the building of this space. To me, sustainability applies not only to the environment, but also to the business.

challenges_faced.lack_of_accessibility: Wanted furniture made with environmentally progressive materials (mushroom mycelium lampshades, 100% recycled plastic chairs) but many not readily available in Singapore or too expensive for small business
challenges_faced.lack_of_know_how: Wanted to design space to minimise air-conditioning use but lacked expertise/advisors
challenges_faced.external_environment: COVID-19 caused spike in takeaway packaging use, opened during Circuit Breaker, securing packaging was challenge, required insane amount of disposable gloves
challenges_faced.educating_customers: Located in old neighbourhood, customers asking for plastic bags, some get worked up when told none available

repurposing_materials: Salvaged timber for shop frontage and café counter
Wood offcuts from Singapore mahogany for dine-in tables
Old fire rated door restored and reused as main entrance
adaptive_solutions.customer_engagement: Specially acknowledge and thank customers who bring own mugs or containers
adaptive_solutions.digital_solutions: Kitchen display system on tablet instead of thermal paper, email receipts
waste_reduction: Give used but clean plastic bags from suppliers
Give away empty alcohol glass bottles
Plan to give away used coffee grounds

local_collaborations.the_table_guy: Created Kizuna Table using exclusively offcuts from larger furniture projects in salvaged Singapore Mahogany wood
local_collaborations.sarah_designer: Zero-waste pattern apron made from gifted fabrics from Musubi
local_collaborations.rehyphen: MusicCloth artwork from discarded cassette tapes, spent 180 minutes weaving Kizuna logo from 'The Art of Noise' tape

education_approach: Whenever we have the time, we share stories like those about the tables and the aprons with the customers. To many of them, offcuts and zero waste patterns are new concepts. I'm happy to be able to expose them to more interpretations of sustainability this way, and I hope for more collaborations in the future to do even more.

customer_education.storytelling: Share stories about tables and aprons with customers
customer_education.new_concepts: Expose customers to offcuts and zero waste patterns
customer_education.regular_customers: Now know we don't offer new plastic bags and bring own carriers

proudest_achievement: I am happy to have built a platform to show that sustainability can be beautiful and feasible for a business, and look forward to more collaborations and more improvements in the future.
business_philosophy: Balancing profit and purpose is a constant challenge for small company with limited resources
practical_compromises: Even though we cannot be 100% sustainable, we can still do whatever we can, with whatever we have, and make improvements when we have the capacity to do so. For instance, we still use plastic Tupperwares at the café because alternatives like glass or metal may not be suitable.
solution_categories_covered: Waste Management - Pantry - Dining Area - Kitchen Corner
Sustainable Supply Chain & Logistic - Eco Design & Circularity
circular_economy_demonstration: Platform to show that sustainability can be beautiful and feasible for business
neighborhood_impact: Introduce sustainability concepts to old neighbourhood in heartlands
